conclusion: To determine variable linear motion, analyze the velocity-time graph.
Variable linear motion occurs when velocity changes over time.
Identify different phases of the velocity-time graph showing change in velocity over time.
Change in velocity over time indicates variable linear motion.
Examine if velocity changes from positive to negative or vice versa.
Graph shows change in velocity from 0 to 2 m/s.
Change in velocity from positive to negative indicates change in direction.
Change in direction confirms variable linear motion.
Graph shows change in velocity over time, confirming variable motion.
Particle undergoes variable linear motion in the first 3 seconds.
Yes, the particle undergoes variable linear motion in the first 3 seconds.
